Good Morning Coventry Comets,

Hey Comet Fans... It's Not Too Late - April 28....

Please cast your vote for the April 28 elections. Hopefully, everyone knows that Coventry Schools has an important Renewal Levy on the ballot. "Not a New Tax"

The only way to vote is by mail with this election. Registered voters must fill out an Absentee Ballot Application to request an official ballot for voting.

To help with the process, if you fill the Absentee Request out, drop it off at any school tomorrow (Thursday, April 23) from
10am - 1pm, the levy committee will hand-deliver your request form to the Board of Elections for you.

In turn, the Board of Elections will mail you an official ballot, so you can cast your vote.

Official ballots must be in the mail by Monday, April 27. Or, voters can hand-deliver their official ballots to the Board of Elections by 7:00 pm on Tuesday, April 28.

For more information about the Renewal Levy - Please visit the Support Coventry Facebook page.

post_text: Last week, the High School Chamber Ensemble participated in a choral festival at the University of Akron, where they performed in EJ Thomas Hall and received feedback from Dr. Paul Rardin of Temple University. Other schools represented were Copley, Hudson, Stow-Munroe Falls, and Woodridge. Our students were so impressive both in their musical presentation and in their enthusiasm to work with and learn from the professional clinician. Their love for music and learning did not go unnoticed: in a follow-up email from the clinician, he stated that he "can't recall working with a group that performed so organically - self-conducted, seemingly fully connected emotionally and musically, singing a repertoire of such global variety and power." Coventry was represented beautifully. We can all be so proud of them!

Visit the link below for information on COVID-19 that Akron Children's is sharing with parents.

https://inside.akronchildrens.org/2020/02/19/what-parents-should-know-about-novel-coronavirus/

So far, there have been very few cases in the US and no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Ohio. However, according to the CDC, communities should be strategizing and preparing for the event of an outbreak. The first line of defense to minimize the spread of this virus, as any other virus, is good hand washing at key times.
